title: Ideal gas law - pressure factor of change

content.question: An ideal gas with initial pressure <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> and temperature <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> is placed inside a flexible, spherical balloon of radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The gas slowly expands at a constant temperature, resulting in the spherical balloon having a final radius of <math alttext="3 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></math>. What is the final pressure of the gas in terms of <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
